meanings.definition: A projecting rim or edge on a pipe or rail, providing strength or support.
meanings.sent1: The metal flange on the pipe helped keep it in place.
meanings.sent2: The workers secured the pipe with a sturdy flange.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the flange of the rail.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the flange that held her fragile spirit together.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the flange made it easy to spot among the pipes.

meanings.definition: To attach or connect by a flange.
meanings.sent1: He needed to flange the two pipes together to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent2: She carefully flanged the pieces to create a strong connection.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to flange the ingredients together for a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was flanged by a shared love for music.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes seemed to flange the colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A type of mechanical joint used in piping systems.
meanings.sent1: The flange connected the two pipes securely.
meanings.sent2: The engineer designed a new flange for the piping system.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse peeked out from behind the large flange.
meanings.sent4: Their partnership was a strong flange in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the flange made it an essential part of the system.
